title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Waste-to-Energy Reverse Trade Mission, through Gas Technology Institute

description.narrative: This contract funds a reverse trade mission to introduce Indonesian delegates from the government, parastatal, and private sectors to U.S. technology, regulations and best practices for biomass and municipal solid waste processing and power generation. The delegates will travel to three cities in the United States in order to meet with U.S. companies and conduct site visits to see American technology manufactured and in use.

title.narrative: Worldwide Global Procurement Initiative Indonesia Orientation Visit, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This proposed Global Procurement Initiative: Indonesia Orientation Visit (OV) will sponsor up to 15 government officials and one U.S. Embassy representative to visit Washington, D.C. and two other U.S. cities for training on international best practices in value-based procurement. The OV supports the Government of Indonesia's ongoing efforts to establish a fair, transparent procurement system that utilizes international best practices.

title.narrative: Training - National Institute of Aeronautics and Space Satellite Imagery Program Training, through Maxar Technologies Inc.

description.narrative: This USTDA training grant is supporting a bid by U.S. firm Maxar Intelligence to supply satellite imagery services to Indonesia's national space agency, the National Institute of Aeronautics and Space ("LAPAN"). The contract would enable LAPAN to obtain, process, and distribute high resolution satellite imagery data for the Government of Indonesia's mapping, environmental monitoring, and disaster response efforts.

title.narrative: Training - Request to convert Agency support from a training grant to a sole-source federal acquisition regulation (FAR) contract, through Maxar Technologies Inc.

description.narrative: This memorandum recommends approval of a no-cost amendment to the Project Memorandum for the Indonesia: Training Grant, LAPAN Satellite Imagery Program, which was approved on March 19, 2021. USTDA approved funding for a Training Grant to fund training in support of Maxar Intelligence Inc.s (Maxar) bid for Indonesias Very High-Resolution Optical Data Program (the Program Contract) via the proposed Grantee, the Indonesia National Institute of Aeronautics and Space (LAPAN). This amendment requests replacing the contractual mechanism by which USTDA funds this activity from a Training Grant with LAPAN to a sole-source contract with Maxar due to inability to identify an entity authorized to serve as a grantee.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - General Electric National Image and Data Repository Pilot Project Feasibility Study, through General Electric Company

description.narrative: This grant funds a pilot project for the Indonesian Ministry of Health (MoH) to conduct a pilot for the development of a national image and data repository (NIDR), which will serve as a cloud-based centralized warehouse for patient records and interpretive reports used for treatment. The pilot would support an overarching Project by demonstrating the viability of the NIDR through a focused approach for cardiac treatment for the transmission of electrocardiogram (ECG) readings, which will be implemented for a subset of ten primary care and hospital facilities.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Mass Rapid Transit Jakarta Renewable Energy Initiative Feasibility Study, through Jacobs Engineering Group, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to support PT Mass Rapid Transit Jakarta (MRT Jakarta) in assessing the viability of implementing a renewable energy initiative that would transition MRT Jakarta's power supply to renewable energy sources. The activity would examine the technical and economic feasibility of installing solar panels on rooftops across the rail system, accessing power from new renewable energy power plants in Indonesia, and implementing energy efficiency and storage projects with a goal of using 100% renewable energy for the rail system's operational needs by 2035.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Smart City Solutions Reverse Trade Mission & Workshop, through Tavaci Partners, LLC

description.narrative: This contract funds a reserve trade mission visit to the United States and an in-country workshop focused on the development of Indonesia's new capital city, Nusantara. The primary objective of the activity is to familiarize Indonesian decision makers with U.S. smart city solutions and best practices to support the successful development and implementation of Nusantara that will replace Jakarta as the country's capital.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - NuScale Small Modular Reactor Technical and Economic Analysis, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance (TA) for PT. Indonesia Power, a state-owned power company in Indonesia, for technical and economic analysis of a 462-megawatt (MW) nuclear power plant using U.S. firm NuScale Power Corporations small modular reactor (SMR) technology in West Kalimantan. The TA would help Indonesia Power assess the technical and economic viability of an SMR nuclear power plant to address growing electricity demand and reduce reliance on fossil fuel-based power generation.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Barat Timur Indonesia Subsea Cable System Feasibility Study, through APTelecom

description.narrative: A USTDA grant for Indonesian company PT Super Sistem Data (SSD) is funding a feasibility study to support the development of the Barat Timur Indonesia subsea fiber optic cable system (BTI Cable System) that will add critical domestic backbone capacity in Indonesia. The study will assess the technical and commercial viability of the cable system, prepare the data and analysis required for financing, and provide detailed plans to guide implementation of the project.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Net Zero World Renewable Energy Mini Grids Feasibility Study, through tQAutomation

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Perusahaan Listrik Negara (PLN), a state-owned Indonesian utility, to assess the technical and economic viability of converting diesel-based generation in five target locations in eastern Indonesia to renewable energy (RE) based mini grids. The study will also develop a roadmap and replication strategy to replace up to 499 MW of small diesel generation with RE mini grids in approximately one quarter of the frontier, outermost and least developed (Terluar, Terpencil, Tertinggal (3T)) regions of Indonesia. The FS would help PLN address growing electricity demand and reduce reliance on fossil fuel-based power generation.

The Feasibility Study (FS) would help PLN address growing electricity demand and reduce reliance on fossil fuel-based power generation.

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Natural Gas Infrastructure, through Innovation Network LLC

description.narrative: This definitional mission (DM) identified and evaluated project opportunities in the realm of natural gas infrastructure development and utilization in Indonesia. The DM Contractor worked with previous USTDA project sponsors such as PT PLN (Persero) and Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGN) and private sector interests to assess prospective projects in the realm of gas pipeline development, gas receiving terminals, combined cycle power plants, liquefied natural gas (LNG) terminals and other areas that would advance economic development as well as U.S. commercial interests in Indonesia's natural gas sector.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Cibuni 30 MW Geothermal Power Development, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: This $546,766 grant supports a feasibility study (FS) for a 30 megawatt (MW) geothermal power project at the Cibuni site in West Java, Indonesia. The purpose of the study is to refine the Cibuni geothermal resource model using specialized U.S. modeling tools, to finalize production well plans, assess power plant siting conditions and technology options, and prepare preliminary engineering designs for the surface gathering system and power plant to facilitate engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) planning for the project. The Cibuni geothermal power plant, once operating, would annually produce about 236.5 million kilowatt hours (Kwh) of electricity, or the power needs of over 400,000 Indonesian citizens, in the form of clean renewable energy.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Liquified Natural Gas Terminal, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: This $341,092 feasibility study grant supports an implementation plan for an approximately 20 million standard cubic feet per day liquefied natural gas (LNG) terminal in East Java, Indonesia. The project will assist Ladang Nusa Gas (PT LNG), a private sector firm that specializes in developing LNG projects in Indonesia, in its efforts to supply LNG from regional gas fields to industrial off takers without access to a gas pipeline. Black & Veatch is contributing resources to the performance of the project.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Revamp of Pertamina Refinery, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: The objective of the Revamp of Pertamina Refinery Units Feasibility Study (FS) in Indonesia is to determine the most cost-effective way of modernizing Pertamina's refinery units in accordance with its Refinery Master Plan. Pertamina's Master Plan addresses the need to modernize the country's refining configuration and capabilities to address the need to process changing sources and quality of crude oils, upgrading the refined product requirements to be consistent with improved environmental standards, and to improve the efficiency and economic viability of the individual refineries.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - National Geospatial Information Infrastructure, through Government of Indonesia

The objective of the National Geospatial Information Infrastructure TA is to enable BIG to enhance its overall geospatial infrastructure architecture and technology roadmap in order to address critical requirements of security, connectivity, and reliability, which are essential for information and communications technology capacity building for Indonesia.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Tangkuban Parahu Geothermal Project, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: USTDA partially funded a detailed geothermal power feasibility study that addressed geothermal plant and system design, surface facility infrastructure, and the project's financing and implementation plan. The project was a joint effort between PT Indonesia Power and Cyrq Energy taking into account the electricity demand and geothermal resource potential of the Tangkuban area in West Java, Indonesia. The USTDA-funded effort assessed the technical, economic, and financial feasibility including plant site and facility requirements and project implementation schedules for the overall geothermal development.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Unconventional Gas Development, through Maritz, LLC

description.narrative: The Unconventional Gas Development Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provided an opportunity for public and private sector officials in Indonesia to meet U.S. developers, suppliers, and regulators of unconventional hydrocarbon production technologies and services. This RTM also provided an opportunity for U.S. companies to learn more about Indonesia's unconventional hydrocarbon market and relevant policies through principal stakeholders. By connecting the delegates with U.S. companies offering relevant products and services, this RTM aimed to help build greater export business for U.S. firms and help Indonesia efficiently develop its unconventional hydrocarbon resources.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - RESTRUCTURING AND REGULATORY REFORM FOR CIVIL AVIATION AUTHORITY, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: This $341,000 Technical Assistance supports the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) in Indonesia in restructuring their operations and strengthening their regulatory functions to ensure the safety and security of the country's aviation services. Recent fatal aviation incidents and accidents resulted in U.S. FAA downgrading and banning of flights in European airspace. The project would improve the overall aviation sector and increase economic growth, as the Indonesian economy is acutely dependent on the operations of a safe and secure aviation sector to move people and goods around the archipelagic country.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - NATIONAL SEARCH AND RESCUE AGENCY CAPACITY EXPANSION, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This Orientation Visit (OV) introduces the National Search and Rescue Agency of Indonesia (BASARNAS) to U.S. search and rescue technology and services. The OV includes visits to three U.S. cities to meet with helicopter manufacturers and communications companies as well as meetings with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security, Coast Guard, Federal Emergency Management Agency as well as local first responders.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - TANGKUBAN PARAHU GEOTHERMAL PROJECT, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: USTDA support of $934,308 partially funds a detailed geothermal power feasibility study that addresses geothermal plant and system design, surface facility infrastructure, and the project's financing and implementation plan. The project is a joint effort between PT Indonesia Power and Raser Technologies Inc. taking into account the electricity demand and geothermal resource potential of the Tangkuban area in West Java, Indonesia. The project will be developed in phases and cost approximately $1 billion. The USTDA-funded effort assesses the technical, economic and financial feasibility including plant site and facility requirements, economic and financial viability, and project implementation schedules for the overall geothermal development.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - JAILOLO GEOTHERMAL POWER PLANT PROJECT, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: This USTDA funding supports a detailed feasilibilty study that focuses on the geothermal plant and systems design, surface facility infrastructure, economic, commercial and financial feasibility, and project implementation plan, taking into account the electricity demand and geothermal resource potential of the Jailolo area. The first phase of the power plant will install and commission two 20MW units to be accomplished in the first five years of the project implementation. As electricity demand on Halmahera expands, a second phase would include the installation of an additional two 110 MW units. PT Star Energy Geothermal Halmahera has selected sole source contractor AECOM USA Inc. to perform the study work.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - GEOTHERMAL POWER DEPLOYMENT TRAINING AND ORIENTATION VISIT PROGRAM, through BCS, Incorporated

description.narrative: This $644,000 Geothermal Power Deployment Training and Orientation Visit Program will help strengthen the capacity of Indonesian provincial government authorities who are responsible for promoting the development of the country's geothermal resources. The training was requested by Indonesian Planning and Development Agency (BAPPENAS) and private sector stakeholders. The training targets six different provinces and includes topics specific to geothermal project development and financing strategies, transparent and comprehensive tendering practices, and fostering a favorable investment climate for energy project development. The visit includes participation by senior decision makers and includes travel to geothermal plant operations to demonstrate U.S. technical solutions and best practices.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - INDONESIA: JAKARTA AIR QUALITY MONITORING AND IMPROVEMENT NETWORK CHANGE ACTIVITY FROM FEASIBILITY STUDY GRANT TO DIRECT CONTRACT TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, through Sullivan Environmental Consulting, Inc.

description.narrative: The $291,000 direct contract technical assistance (initially a $291,000 feasibility study grant) aims to help implement an Air Quality Monitoring and Improvement Project overseen by Daerah Khusu Ibukota Jakarta (DKI Jakarta), the provincial government of Jakarta, Indonesia. The assistance determines the appropriate equipment, configuration, and monitoring locations for an air quality monitoring network project in the greater Jakarta region. The project to be implemented would entail the installation and operation of fifteen new stationary air quality monitoring stations and one mobile air quality monitoring unit. This network of stations will assess air pollution impacts from the transportation, domestic, and industrial sectors. This information will guide the policy decision for air quality management of the Jakarta provincial government, DKI Jakarta.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Definitional Mission - Water and Wastewater Management, through Green Power Systems, LLC

description.narrative: This $80,000 Definitional Mission (DM) identifies and evaluates opportunities in the water and wastewater management sector in Indonesia and Vietnam for USTDA funding consideration. The rapid urbanization in the southern region of Vietnam in recent years has exacerbated the existing water and wastewater infrastructure, while Indonesia has among the lowest standards for water quality supply and treatment in the region. The DM contractor will travel for at least three weeks to the countries and identify at least six (6) activities for USTDA funding consideration.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Water supply and sanitation - large systems

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - Air Traffic Control Reverse Trade Mission, through MFM Lamey Group, LLC

description.narrative: This $222,473 reverse trade mission brings Indonesian senior delegates from the civil aviation sector, particularly concerned with air traffic management and control (ATM/ATC), to the U.S. to gain exposure to advanced U.S. service providers, technology manufacturers, regulators, and sites showcasing ATM/ATC systems in operation.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Rail Signaling and Telecommunications Systems, through Government of Indonesia

description.narrative: This $593,954 technical assistance assists PT Kereta Api Indonesia (PT KAI), Indonesia's state-owned rail company, in evaluating the development of rail signaling and telecommunications systems in Indonesia. This project assists PT KAI in developing a strategic plan and specific system recommendations for upgrading its rail signaling and telecommunications network.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Eastern Airspace Aviation Safety, through Boeing Company

description.narrative: This Eastern Airspace Aviation Safety technical assistance grant provides for the development of a Concept of Operations (ConOps) for the Directorate General of Civil Aviation of Indonesia to help improve the safety of flight and quality of air navigation in Papua and Maluku in the eastern region of Indonesia. The intended outcome of the ConOps is to provide a recommended implementation guideline for the Papua and Maluku airspace and aviation safety program goals and objectives, required capabilities, and the changes needed to realize the Project's objectives. Over the long term the Project is designed to help increase aviation sector efficiencies, diminish operational inconsistencies in systems, reduce cost, and increase safety of the sector.

title.narrative: Orientation Visit - UNCONVENTIONAL GAS DEVELOPMENT, through Maritz, LLC

description.narrative: This $242,416 Unconventional Gas Development Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) provides an opportunity for public and private sector officials in Indonesia to meet U.S. developers, suppliers, and regulators of unconventional hydrocarbon production technologies and services. This RTM also provides an opportunity for U.S. companies to learn more about Indonesia's unconventional hydrocarbon market and relevant policies through principal stakeholders. By connecting the delegates with U.S. companies offering relevant products and services, this RTM helps build greater export business for U.S. firms and helps Indonesia efficiently develop its unconventional hydrocarbon resources.
